title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp rages at fourth official before apologising following draw with Chelsea at Anfield
text:

Jurgen Klopp came under fire after screaming in fourth official Neil Swarbrick's face in Liverpool 's 1-1 draw with Chelsea. 
The German reacted furiously when Simon Mignolet palmed Diego Costa's spot kick away, before shouting, "no one can beat us." 
Klopp's side picked up a point thanks to Georginio Wijnaldum's header, which cancelled out David Luiz's sublime free-kick. 
Robbie Savage questioned whether a ban would be appropriate after Arsene Wenger was hit with a four-game ban for pushing the fourth official in Arsenal's 2-1 win over Burnley. 
Savage Tweeted: "Will Klopp get punished for his reaction to the 4th official when Costa penalty saved? #shocking Read More 
"Just asking the question! What if that was Mourinho or Wenger?" 
Klopp later revealed he apologised and that Swarbrick replied, "no problem, I like your passion."
